intent: Initialize a new plain Expo mobile project to serve as the foundation for the mobile app. We will use Expo Go for development.
instructions: If not already created, create a new plain Expo project using 'npx create-expo-app' (TypeScript preferred). Ensure minimal dependencies, clean folder structure, and confirm it builds successfully. Do not add navigation or state libraries yet.
acceptance_criteria: Expo project is created successfully
Project builds and runs
No unused boilerplate or demo screens remain

intent: Assess baseline Expo project readiness and constraints.
instructions: Confirm whether an Expo app already exists in easeclassifieds-mobile. If absent, note that creation is required. Verify Node/Expo CLI versions, Expo Go availability, and ability to run expo start --tunnel. Identify any blockers (ports, missing SDK) before implementation.
acceptance_criteria: Existing project presence confirmed or absence noted
Tooling versions and Expo Go availability recorded
Potential blockers listed (ports, SDK, permissions)
Recommended next steps documented

intent: Set up React Navigation for the Expo app with tab and stack navigation structure.
instructions: Install and configure @react-navigation/native, @react-navigation/native-stack, and @react-navigation/bottom-tabs with peer deps react-native-screens and react-native-safe-area-context. Create navigation structure matching web routes: Home (Feed), Favorites, Search, Profile. Set up proper TypeScript types for navigation. Keep Expo Go compatibility (no custom native modules).
acceptance_criteria: React Navigation is installed and configured
Bottom tab navigation is working with 4 tabs
Stack navigation is set up for detail screens
Navigation types are properly defined

intent: Assess navigation requirements and route parity.
instructions: Map existing web routes (Home/Feed, Favorites, Search, Listing Detail, Profile) and any modal flows. Decide stack vs tab structure, initial route, and detail screen params. Confirm no native-linking dependencies. Output a short routing plan and param types to implement.
acceptance_criteria: Route list with stack/tab assignment documented
Initial route and param shapes defined
Modal/sheet needs noted (if any)
No native-linking blockers identified

intent: Set up NativeWind (Tailwind for React Native) and design system tokens.
instructions: Install and configure NativeWind with tailwindcss (Expo preset) and required Babel/Metro settings. Create design system tokens for colors, spacing, typography matching web app; consider clsx/tailwind-merge for class composition. Set up theme provider for light/dark mode support if needed. Keep config plugin-free for Expo Go.
acceptance_criteria: NativeWind is installed and working
Design tokens match web app styling
Typography scale is mobile-optimized and readable
Color scheme is consistent with web version

intent: Assess styling approach and token mapping from web to mobile.
instructions: Review web Tailwind config and design tokens (colors, spacing, typography). Identify which tokens map directly and which need mobile adjustments (font sizes/line heights). Confirm NativeWind requirements (babel/metro) and note any Tailwind plugins to omit. Produce a token mapping plan.
acceptance_criteria: Web Tailwind tokens reviewed
Mobile-adjusted typography scale decided
Plugin omissions/changes noted
Token mapping plan documented

intent: Port API client and services layer to React Native.
instructions: Migrate services/api.ts with axios for HTTP calls. Set up API base URL configuration. Port authService, listingService, searchService, feedService, subscriptionService, and favoritesService. Use expo-secure-store for tokens (fallback to @react-native-async-storage/async-storage for non-sensitive cache). Ensure proper error handling and interceptors.
acceptance_criteria: API client is configured with proper base URL
All service modules are ported and typed
Token persistence works with AsyncStorage
Request/response interceptors handle auth properly

intent: Assess API surface and service parity for mobile client.
instructions: Inventory existing web services (auth/listing/search/feed/subscription/favorites) and endpoints they call. Note required headers, interceptors, and error formats. Confirm mobile API base URL sources (env). Identify any browser-only dependencies to remove. Produce a service mapping and interceptor plan (auth retry, error normalization).
acceptance_criteria: Service list with endpoints and required params documented
Header/auth/interceptor behavior described
Browser-only dependencies identified
Plan for token storage and error normalization documented

intent: Set up environment configuration for Expo (API base, secrets, build variants).
instructions: Use app.config.js (or app.config.ts) with expo-constants extra for API base, feature flags, and Gemini key (if used). Avoid react-native-config (not Expo Go-friendly). Ensure axios client pulls base URL from config. Document how to run against local backend via expo start --tunnel. Avoid embedding secrets in code; keep secrets server-side when possible.
acceptance_criteria: Env vars for API base and secrets are defined and loaded in Expo
Axios client reads base URL from env
Local and remote backend targets are documented
No secrets are hardcoded in source

intent: Assess environment/config needs for mobile app.
instructions: List required env values (API base, feature flags, Gemini key if used). Check current web/env usage and align names. Decide dev vs prod values and whether tunnel base URL is needed. Confirm no secrets must ship to client. Produce a config plan using app.config.(js/ts) extras and expo-constants.
acceptance_criteria: Env variable list documented with naming
Dev/prod/tunnel base URL approach noted
Secret-handling approach documented
Plan for app.config extras and client consumption recorded

intent: Port shared types, constants, and utilities from web to React Native without DOM dependencies.
instructions: Migrate listing types, enums, and helper utilities (formatters, filters) from the web app. Replace any browser-specific APIs with React Native equivalents. Ensure type parity with backend API contracts. Centralize constants (tiers, categories, endpoints) for reuse across screens.
acceptance_criteria: Core types/enums mirror web and backend contracts
Helpers work in React Native without DOM or window usage
Constants for tiers/categories/endpoints are shared across screens
Type errors are resolved in the mobile project

intent: Assess types/constants/utilities to port from web.
instructions: Inventory web types (listing, user, subscription tiers), constants, and utilities used by Home/Search/Favorites/Profile. Identify browser APIs (localStorage, window, document) to remove. Cross-check with backend contracts to ensure type parity. Produce a porting list and gaps.
acceptance_criteria: Types/constants/utilities list compiled
Browser-only dependencies identified
Backend contract parity checked
Porting plan documented

intent: Create phone authentication screens with OTP verification.
instructions: Build PhoneInputScreen with country selector (PK, AE, SA, QA, KW, BH, OM) and phone number input (use numeric keypad). Build OTPVerificationScreen with 4-6 digit OTP input; set textContentType oneTimeCode. Implement auth flow using authService and tokens stored via expo-secure-store. Handle rate limiting errors gracefully. Add loading states and error messages.
acceptance_criteria: Phone input screen with country selector works
OTP input screen with proper keyboard type
Auth flow completes successfully
Rate limiting messages display properly
Loading and error states are user-friendly

intent: Create Home/Feed screen with category selector and listing feed.
instructions: Port HomePage logic to React Native. Use FlatList for listings with proper optimization (keyExtractor, removeClippedSubviews, windowSize). Port CategorySelector component. Port FeedMetadataBar showing remaining views. Implement pull-to-refresh. Use React Native list performance best practices.
acceptance_criteria: Feed screen displays listings from API
Category filter switches between properties/vehicles/all
Feed metadata shows daily curated feed stats
Pull-to-refresh works smoothly
List scrolling is performant with many items

intent: Create ListingCard component for displaying listing previews.
instructions: Port ListingCard to React Native. Use Image with proper resizeMode. Show price, title, location, category badge. Add favorite button. Handle image loading states and errors. Make card touchable to navigate to detail. Ensure proper spacing and mobile-friendly touch targets (min 44x44).
acceptance_criteria: Listing cards display all required info
Images load properly with placeholders
Favorite toggle button works
Cards are tappable with good touch feedback
Layout is optimized for mobile screens

intent: Create listing detail screen with full information and image gallery.
instructions: Port ListingDetailPage to React Native. Use ScrollView for content. Implement image gallery with horizontal paging (FlatList or react-native-pager-view). Show all listing details, description, contact info. Add favorite button. Add share functionality. Handle loading and error states.
acceptance_criteria: Detail screen shows complete listing info
Image gallery works with swipe navigation
Favorite and share buttons are functional
Layout is mobile-optimized and readable
Contact information is tappable (call/message)

intent: Create search screen with smart search and filters.
instructions: Port SmartSearchBar and search functionality. Use TextInput for search query. Implement filter UI for category, price range, location. Port Gemini AI integration for smart search if feasible on mobile, or use regular search. Show search results in FlatList. Handle empty states and loading.
acceptance_criteria: Search input works with proper keyboard
Filters can be applied and cleared
Search results display correctly
Smart search integration works or gracefully falls back
Empty and loading states are user-friendly

intent: Create favorites screen showing user's bookmarked listings.
instructions: Port FavoritesPage to React Native. Use FlatList for favorites list. Port useFavorites hook and FavoritesContext. Implement add/remove favorites functionality. Show empty state when no favorites. Allow navigation to listing details. Support pull-to-refresh.
acceptance_criteria: Favorites screen displays user's saved listings
Add/remove favorites works properly
Empty state is shown when appropriate
Pull-to-refresh updates favorites list
Navigation to detail screen works

intent: Create profile/subscription screen with tier information (view-only, no payment integration).
instructions: Build profile screen showing user phone number, current subscription tier, and tier features. Display subscription tier information (FREE, BASIC, PRO) as informational cards only. Show remaining daily views and renewal date. Add logout button. Do not implement payment or upgrade functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Profile shows user info and current tier
Subscription tiers are displayed as informational cards
Tier features and limits are visible (read-only)
Logout functionality works
UI is mobile-friendly and readable
No payment buttons or upgrade flows present

intent: Port shared/reusable components from web to React Native.
instructions: Port Button, Input, ErrorBoundary, LoadingSpinner, EmptyState components to React Native. Create mobile-optimized versions with proper touch targets. Ensure consistent styling. Add proper accessibility labels. Create design system components folder.
acceptance_criteria: All shared components are ported
Components follow React Native best practices
Touch targets meet mobile guidelines (44x44)
Accessibility labels are present
Styling is consistent across components

intent: Harden mobile UX for accessibility, safe areas, and status bar handling.
instructions: Integrate SafeAreaView/StatusBar handling for all screens. Ensure focus order, accessibility labels, and minimum touch targets are applied. Verify high-contrast mode and dynamic font scaling where feasible. Add keyboard avoidance for inputs on auth/search screens.
acceptance_criteria: Safe areas handled on iOS and Android
Status bar styles set per screen theme
Accessible labels and touch targets present across interactive elements
Keyboard avoidance works on input-heavy screens

intent: Implement offline detection and basic offline functionality.
instructions: Port useOffline hook using @react-native-community/netinfo. Show offline banner when network is unavailable. Cache recent listings using @react-native-async-storage/async-storage (or lightweight in-memory cache) for non-sensitive data. Handle API errors gracefully when offline. Show cached data when offline.
acceptance_criteria: Offline detection works correctly
Offline banner displays when network is down
Recent listings are cached locally
Cached data is shown when offline
User is informed about offline limitations

intent: Set up notification system for in-app messages and alerts.
instructions: Port Notification component to React Native using a JS-only toast library (e.g., react-native-toast-message) or lightweight banner modal. Handle success, error, and info notifications. Ensure notifications don't block user interaction. Add notification context/provider. Keep Expo Go compatible (no native config plugins).
acceptance_criteria: Notification system works on mobile
Toast/banner notifications display correctly
Different notification types are styled appropriately
Notifications auto-dismiss after timeout
Multiple notifications are queued properly

intent: Set up icon library and handle image assets for mobile.
instructions: Install/use @expo/vector-icons (Expo-bundled) for icons (lucide equivalent via Feather set). Use expo-image for performant images with placeholders. Set up proper image asset handling with different resolutions (@2x, @3x). Configure app icon and splash screen in app.json/app.config.js. Ensure all web icons have mobile equivalents.
acceptance_criteria: Icon library is configured and working
All UI icons render correctly
Image assets are optimized for mobile
App icon and splash screen are set
Icons are crisp on all screen densities

intent: Create comprehensive documentation for the mobile app.
instructions: Create README.md with setup instructions, environment variables, and running instructions. Document component structure and navigation flow. Add mobile-specific notes (deep linking, push notifications for future). Document differences from web app. Create troubleshooting guide.
acceptance_criteria: README.md has clear setup instructions
Architecture and component structure documented
Environment variables are documented
Known issues and limitations are noted
Future enhancements are listed

intent: Validate and document API response contracts required for mobile clients.
instructions: Audit vehicle, property, and favourites APIs from a mobile-client perspective. Document required fields, optional fields, pagination shape, error formats, and auth expectations. Do not change behavior yet.
acceptance_criteria: Clear API contract notes for vehicle, property, and favourites endpoints
Mobile-required fields explicitly listed
Known inconsistencies or gaps documented

intent: If required, Fix and stabilize the vehicle listings API to support mobile consumption.
instructions: First check if fix is needed. Review the vehicle listings aggregation and API endpoints. Fix data inconsistencies, pagination issues, and performance bottlenecks. Ensure response shape is mobile-friendly and documented.
acceptance_criteria: Vehicle listings API returns consistent, normalized data
Pagination and filtering work as expected
Response times are within acceptable limits

intent: Assess vehicle listings API for gaps before applying fixes.
instructions: Call GET /api/listings?category=vehicles with pagination and filters used by mobile. Validate shape against mobile contract (id, title, price, currency, location, thumbnails, mileage/year/specs, dealer vs private). Check pagination (page/limit/total), sorting, null fields, and performance (basic timing). Document any inconsistencies or missing fields; do not change code in this task.
acceptance_criteria: Response shape documented against required fields
Pagination/filters behavior noted
Performance observations captured
Clear list of issues/gaps produced

intent: If required, Fix and stabilize the property listings API to support mobile consumption.
instructions: First check if fix is needed. Audit property aggregation pipelines and API endpoints. Resolve missing fields, normalization issues, and edge cases. Align response format with vehicle listings where applicable.
acceptance_criteria: Property listings API returns complete and normalized data
Edge cases and invalid listings are handled safely
API contract is consistent and documented

intent: Assess property listings API for gaps before applying fixes.
instructions: Call GET /api/listings?category=properties with pagination and property filters. Validate shape against mobile contract (id, title, price, currency, location, bedrooms, bathrooms, area, propertyType, thumbnails). Check pagination metadata, null handling, and filter coverage. Document inconsistencies or missing fields; no code changes in this task.
acceptance_criteria: Property response shape documented
Pagination and filters behavior noted
Null/edge cases identified
Issues/gaps list produced

intent: If required, Fix and finalize the favourites API used by web and mobile clients.
instructions: First check if fix is needed. Ensure favourites can be added, removed, and listed reliably per user (phone-auth based). Validate authorization, idempotency, and error handling.
acceptance_criteria: Users can add and remove favourites reliably
Favourites persist correctly across sessions
Unauthorized access is rejected

intent: Assess favourites API behavior before fixes.
instructions: Exercise POST/DELETE/GET favourites endpoints using phone-auth sessions. Verify idempotency on add/remove, correct ownership scoping, pagination (if any), and error responses for unauthorized/invalid IDs. Document any inconsistencies or missing fields required by mobile. No code changes in this task.
acceptance_criteria: Behavior for add/remove/list documented
Idempotency and auth checks verified
Error responses captured
Issues/gaps list produced
